message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with computational geometry, specifically the computation of the area and perimeter of the convex hull of a set of points in the plane. This falls under the category of computational geometry (cs.CG). The paper also discusses the complexity of computing the probability distribution function of the convex hull, which involves counting problems and probabilistic algorithms, suggesting that it could also be classified under data structures (cs.DS), discrete mathematics (cs.DM), and complexity theory (cs.CC). Finally, the paper mentions Monte Carlo algorithms, which are commonly used in numerical analysis (cs.NA).
